titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William F. White and John Payne, Indictment
CWG5052

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Fayette CIRCUIT COURT.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
AGAINST
William F White & John Payne

THE GRAND JURY of Fayette county, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse William F White & John Payne of the offence of setting up Faro Bank & Dealing Faro committed as follows, viz: The said William F White & John Payne on the 4th day of February 18634 in the county aforesaid, did set up, exhibit and keep for themselves and others a Faro Bank used in betting and games of chance, upon which Faro Bank, money, property, Bank Notes, National Treasury Notes and other things of value were bet, won and lost against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

W. S. DOWNEY,
COMMONWEALTH'S ATTORNEY,
WITNESSES:
Bowman Barclay,
Benjamin Blincoe
Peter Tighe,
James Kendall,
John Warnock,
Clem Paynn,
Henry Metcalf,
Rufus Lisle,
Mitch Lawrence
Thos H Moore
R B Shelton.
A Copy- att Jno B Nortom c f c c
By Chas. F Lowry D C

Fayette Cir Ct
Comth of Kentucky
vs
White William F & Payne John
Copy IndictA true bill-
S S Thompson
Foreman.
$500 each.

Remitted Bond & Pardoned Offence as to White
20th June/64

Returned into Court Feby 20th 1864.
Att Jno B Norton c
